newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Santos says Cooper restrictions gone.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Santos says Cooper restrictions gone.

text.p: Santos Ltd said on Friday the South Australian government had given an undertaking to it and other Cooper Basin gas producers that there would be no restriction on their ability to sell gas in South Australia or elsewhere.
"This is significant in enabling the producers to sell uncontracted gas in the future without restriction," Santos said in a statement.
The undertaking follows the signing by the Cooper Basin gas producers of detailed sale agreements with the South Australian Gas Co Ltd (Sagasco) and with ETSA Corp.
The contracts, which followed preliminary agreements announced earlier this year, are for a total of 180 petajoules (PJ) of gas to Sagasco and 120 PJ to ETSA.

Santos said the contracts reflected an undertaking the producers gave to the state of South Australia in 1994 to sell 400 PJ of gas to users in South Australia with the remaining 100 PJ of the 400 PJ committed to the Natural Gas Authority of South Australia.
"These three contracts have now fulfilled this undertaking. Sales contracts for Cooper Basin gas customers in South Australia now extend until 2013," Santos said.

The other Cooper Basin producers include Boral Energy Resources, a unit of Boral Ltd, Crusader Resources, a unit of Clyde Petroleum Plc and Delhi Petroleum, a unit of Exxon Corp. Santos said the contracts were made on similar commercial terms to the other existing South Australian Cooper Basin gas sales contracts.
